title: Mulan: Disney remakes and the power of nostalgia during coronavirus
description: Mulan is the latest animation to be made live-action. Why is Disney remaking so many films?

title: California assemblywoman brings newborn to the legislature floor.
description: Buffy Wicks was denied a request to vote remotely during maternity leave so she brought her daughter to work.

title: Coronavirus in South Africa: Scientists explore surprise explanation for low death rate
description: Rather than helping spread coronavirus, might overcrowding actually mitigate its effects?

title: US elections 2020: Fact-checking Trump on crime in Democratic-run cities
description: US president has made urban crime an issue, but is he right about who runs the most violent cities?

title: How Covid-19 myths are merging with the QAnon conspiracy theory
description: Online and in real-life demonstrations, two viral conspiracy theories are increasingly coming together.

title: Moments of joy between mothers and children in prison
description: Photographer Jadwiga Bronte uses portraits to document the experiences of mothers in prison.

title: Mishal Husain: My grandfather’s war
description: The BBC presenter revisits her grandfather’s experience of serving in the British Indian Army during WW2.

title: School return: 'It's going to get me back on track'
description: Riverside School in Barking show us what plans they've implemented as they welcome pupils back.

title: What a US ban on WeChat could mean for American firms
description: What effect could President Trump's proposed WeChat ban have on US companies?

title: Why 600 books are being published on Thursday
description: Lockdown delayed the publication of many books, and authors now face big competition to get noticed.

title: Body neutrality: What if you don't really love or hate your body?
description: Body neutrality encourages people to appreciate their bodies for what it does, rather than how it looks.

title: The other public health crisis killing Canadians
description: Since March, Canada has rushed to contain the virus. But some life-saving measures are killing Canadians.

title: Kickstart work scheme: 'It's really hard to get a job'
description: Many young people are out of work in the pandemic, but a new government scheme aims to help them find jobs.

title: Navalny 'Novichok poisoning' a test for the West
description: The use of a nerve agent tends to point the finger of suspicion at the Russian state, Frank Gardner writes.

title: Rule, Britannia! will be sung on Last Night of the Proms after BBC U-turn
description: There had been fierce criticism after the lyrics were dropped for The Last Night of the Proms.

title: Girl Guides: Enhanced photos need labels on social media
description: The charity has backed proposals to make labelling on these images compulsory.

title: Police safety: Four in 10 officers say they were assaulted last year
description: A survey of 40,000 officers also finds that nearly nine in ten have been attacked during their career.

title: Black holes: Cosmic signal rattles Earth after 7 billion years
description: Gravitational waves arrive from a black hole collision that occurred half-way across the Universe.

title: Ofqual warned grades system would not win public support
description: Ministers were warned replacement results would be "enormously difficult" and unlikely to win support.

title: Greater Manchester lockdown easing U-turn after cases rise
description: Plans to ease restrictions in Bolton and Trafford are scrapped after a spike in Covid-19 cases.

title: Richard Rogers retires: Pompidou and Dome architect helped shape our cities
description: He overcame controversy to become one of a handful of architects credited with shaping modern cities.

title: Gossip update: Messi's father in Spain for Barca talks
description: Messi's father arrives for Barcelona future talks, Wijnaldum agrees Nou Camp move, PSG bid for Bellerin, plus more.

title: Apple more valuable than the entire FTSE 100
description: The world's largest company has seen its value leap as demand for tech goods surged during lockdown.

title: Coronavirus: London's Winter Wonderland event cancelled
description: Organisers hope the event in London's Hyde Park will return in November 2021.

title: Coronavirus: How it feels to be going back to school
description: The BBC speaks to parents to discover how they feel as they take their children back to school.

title: World Championship return would be 'incredible', says Hendry as he announces comeback
description: Stephen Hendry says it would be "incredible" if he could achieve his goal of playing at the Crucible in a World Championship after announcing his return to professional snooker.

title: Fans may be able to return for Arsenal v Sheff Utd in October
description: Arsenal hope fans will be able to attend their home Premier League fixture against Sheffield United on 3 October.

title: Coronavirus: Tui halts trips to Zante resort of Laganas after virus clusters
description: Some customers are not social distancing at the party resort on the Greek island, the firm says.

title: Millions of pupils return after historic shutdown
description: Pupils are back at school in England and Wales this week, but are finding changes to make them safer.

title: Charlie Hebdo: 14 suspects on trial over Paris massacre
description: They are accused of helping Islamist militants stage the 2015 Charlie Hebdo attack that killed 12.

title: Lionel Messi: Is Barcelona captain and Man City target as good as ever?
description: With Manchester City investigating the possibility of signing Lionel Messi, BBC Sport examines whether he is still the best player in the world.

title: Tenet gives shot in arm to UK and Ireland cinemas
description: Christopher Nolan's time-bending spy thriller takes £5.33 million in its first week on release.

title: Strictly Come Dancing: Ex-boxer Nicola Adams to have same-sex dance partner
description: Olympic boxer Nicola Adams will form Strictly Come Dancing's first competitive same-sex pairing.

title: David Byrne apologises for wearing blackface in 1984
description: "I have changed since then," says the Talking Heads star after a clip from the 1980s resurfaces.

title: Real Madrid's Rodriguez close to joining Everton
description: Everton are hopeful of completing a deal worth more than £20m for Real Madrid attacking midfielder James Rodriguez by the end of the week.

title: C-section guilt: ‘I felt like I’d failed’

title: Disabled fashion: 'There are so many clothes I can't wear'

description: The boxer chats about his defeat by Alexander Povetkin, his future and the Black Lives Matter movement.

description: Britain’s Andy Murray says his return to Grand Slams was "emotional" after coming back from two sets down to reach round two at the US Open.

title: What your children will see when they return to school
description: Children in the UK are returning to school for the autumn term, after Covid-19 disruption.

title: After six months at home, this separation will not be easy
description: An educational psychologist says children might be worried going back after such a long time at home.
